overview: From 2026-01-01 to 2026-02-01, elizaos/eliza had 38 new PRs (22 merged), 100 new issues, and 31 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Can not generate project
topIssues.author: Abdulkader-Safi
topIssues.body: **Can not generate project** Hello, I just found about this project and I followed the documention on getting started on the website https://docs.elizaos.ai/, but I am getting errors when I run elizaos create **To Reproduce** I run ```bash bun i -g elizaos ``` after that I run ```bash elizaos create ``` what I get ```bash ‚ùØ elizaos create node:internal/modules/esm/resolve:313 return new ERR_PACKAGE_PATH_NOT_EXPORTED( ^ Error [ERR_PACKAGE_PATH_NOT_EXPORTED]: Package subpath './dist/index.js' is not defined by "exports" in /Users/safi/.bun/install/global/node_modules/@elizaos/cli/package.json imported from /Users/safi/.bun/install/global/node_modules/elizaos/bin/elizaos.js at exportsNotFound (node:internal/modules/esm/resolve:313:10) at packageExportsResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/resolve:660:9) at packageResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/resolve:773:12) at moduleResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/resolve:853:18) at defaultResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/resolve:983:11) at #cachedDefaultResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:731:20) at ModuleLoader.resolve (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:708:38) at ModuleLoader.getModuleJobForImport (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:310:38) at ModuleJob._link (node:internal/modules/esm/module_job:182:49) { code: 'ERR_PACKAGE_PATH_NOT_EXPORTED' } Node.js v22.21.0 ``` **Expected behavior** the expected behavior to generate prject **Screenshots**

topIssues.title: "Reflection evaluator fails with 'Entity not found' - UPDATE_CONTACT requires entity initialization"
topIssues.author: thewoweffect

topIssues.title: [Plugin] Integrate N8N Workflow Engine
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Integrate N8N workflow engine as the primary automation layer for Eliza App. N8N provides pre-built nodes for Gmail, Notion, Calendar, and hundreds of other services.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] N8N plugin from V2 branch working in cloud
- [ ] Agent can generate workflow JSONs via natural language
- [ ] Workflows can be stored per user/tenant
- [ ] Execution via [N8N.io](<http://N8N.io>) or self-hosted execution server
- [ ] Query available nodes and expose to agent

## Technical Notes

**From today's meeting (Shaw):**

* N8N plugin already exists in V2 branch - generates JSON workflows
* "We get every single thing" - Gmail, Notion, Reddit, literally every connector exists
* Two parts: (1) Generate JSON workflows (no sandbox needed), (2) Execute via N8N server
* Can use [N8N.io](<http://N8N.io>) hosted execution initially, self-host later for cost optimization
* Workflow generation is just JSON - can happen serverlessly
* Also need to pull in pre-existing workflows from GitHub (many already exist)
* "I really think we could get this done today" - Shaw

## Architecture

1. User says "check my gmail every morning"
2. Agent generates N8N workflow JSON
3. Agent requests OAuth credentials if needed
4. Workflow submitted to N8N execution server
5. Results returned to user

## Priority

**P0 - Core Architecture**

topIssues.title: [Migration] Eligibility Mismatch & Snapshot Bug - Tangem Hardware Wallet
topIssues.author: Zenobow
topIssues.body:
Description: I am reporting a discrepancy in my $ai16z migration eligibility. My current $ai16z holdings are consolidated in my Tangem hardware wallet. During the official snapshot on Nov 11, 2025 (11:40 UTC), this wallet held the bulk of my tokens.

The Problem: When I connect to the migration portal (migrate.elizafoundation.ai), the system only recognizes a small fraction (710 tokens) which were held in a separate Solflare hot-wallet at the time. My Tangem wallet's snapshot balance is not being correctly identified or synced by the portal.

Verified On-Chain Evidence (Tangem Wallet):

Holding Address: 2SELmng3aKdrPKad41PEZA5XAt5Hex8TCpKrwY8AX8K8

Snapshot Balance (Nov 11): 70,000 $ai16z

Supporting Transaction Hashes:

4gPGjNc31yPwJrSomHEgwGAWQyJcPmgYUKw8iu4NaMTQhTgEjvdd1TdwyEphg2qfhHvqmony5kHzJFhQa6syDNWb [43,000 ai16z]

363QaEUbGTnDVK9Uvm9xqnDaphpdSY5YaQjgdC9xi3AcbNZJpW7H7gbEvaCLL5fcSoD1PeGqwddfgXbo6pC5Jfav [17,000 ai16z]

5KDLm7qA71yrGfUW6SxzVTWY4KxBeYxuAPiWZWTAG4Y6xMex1JbjfzAYuDWTR86oKTXMcy2WDLAdnSgagKbR9x6q [8,000 ai16z]

36UzzHTLVVN6xsi96YWZqCApkUfA8Z9T5AuXRuBi8ti1nvpQ6aS2tgcBYbRz497dAzAkdanefBZSGYm2Qyp9TSEi [2,000 ai16z]

Request: Please manually verify the snapshot data for address 2SELmng3aKdrPKad41PEZA5XAt5Hex8TCpKrwY8AX8K8 and whitelist the full eligible amount for the 1:6 $ELIZAOS swap. As Tangem does not support seed phrase export and has connection issues with the portal, I need this backend update to proceed before the February 4th deadline.

Thank you for your help!

topPRs.title: V2.0.0
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This is  a working branch of elizaOS v2.0.0

Critically, this removes app, server, CLI and all non-essentials. Instead, we focus on runtime in Rust, Typescript, with critical plugins ported as well

topPRs.title: fix(v2.0.0): Python example testing & fixes
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
- Add Python quickstart documentation (docs/python-quickstart.md) - Fix chat example to include inmemorydb plugin for database support - Add dotenv loading to chat example for .env file support - Fix inmemorydb plugin to use proper Plugin class instead of dict - Fix inmemorydb adapter to accept params dict in get_memories() - Fix inmemorydb adapter to handle Pydantic models in create_memory/update_memory - Fix character provider to use getattr for optional attributes - Add get_available_actions() method to AgentRuntime - Add get_entity() alias method to AgentRuntime - Update get_memories() to accept keyword arguments The Python port had issues because: Plugin export - was a dict instead of Plugin object Method signatures - expected dicts but got Pydantic models No type enforcement - Python doesn't catch these at compile time The Rust type system prevents these bugs automatically. The Python fixes we made bring it to parity with the working Rust implementation. # Risks Medium # Background ## What does this PR do? Fix examples/chat/python ## What kind of change is this? Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) ## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work? Review # Documentation changes needed? maybe --- > [!NOTE] > Introduces true streaming and stabilizes Python runtime/plugins, plus major example and training additions. > > - Adds streaming text APIs: new `ModelType.TEXT_*_STREAM`, `AgentRuntime.use_model_stream()`/`register_streaming_model()`, and `DefaultMessageService.handle_message_stream()` with `StreamingMessageResult` > - OpenAI plugin implements streaming handlers; core exports updated to include streaming types > - Fixes `plugin-inmemorydb`: converted to proper `Plugin`, adapter now accepts `params`/kwargs, handles Pydantic models (camelCase keys), and corrects pagination/filters > - Hardens character provider to safely access optional fields via `getattr` > - AgentRuntime enhancements: `get_available_actions()`, `get_entity()` alias, `get_memories()` kwargs support > - A2A FastAPI server uses true token-by-token SSE streaming and includes `inmemorydb`; requirements updated > - Chat example loads `.env` and includes `inmemorydb` plugin > - ART Tic‚ÄëTac‚ÄëToe: adds heuristic agent, refines config (`opponent`, `ai_player`), winner/draw handling, and CLI updates > - New Atropos TextWorld package: environment/agents, trajectory + tokenizer tooling, offline data generation, BaseEnv factory, and CLI; README expanded > - Core Python README and example docs updated for setup and usage > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 21f8c31fc22b7778f998d85c754ee82a0a8e2253. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).

Greptile Overview

### Greptile Summary This PR fixes the Python chat example and inmemorydb plugin to work together, adds Python quickstart documentation, and improves Character attribute handling. The changes include: **Key Improvements:** - Adds comprehensive Python quickstart documentation with examples - Fixes inmemorydb plugin to use proper Plugin class instead of dict - Enhances inmemorydb adapter to handle Pydantic models in create_memory/update_memory - Updates character provider to safely access optional attributes with getattr() - Adds dotenv support to chat example for .env file loading - Adds useful helper methods to AgentRuntime (get_available_actions, get_entity alias) - Enhances get_memories() to accept keyword arguments **Critical Issues Found:** 1. **Bug in adapter.py line 329**: The update_memory() method references the wrong variable name (`memory` instead of `memory_dict`), which will cause AttributeError when processing Pydantic models 2. **Bug in character.py lines 70-73**: Inconsistent attribute access - uses getattr() in function body but direct access in return data dict, causing AttributeError for optional attributes 3. **Missing dependency in chat.py**: Imports python-dotenv but it's not in requirements.txt 4. **Incomplete documentation**: Quickstart guide doesn't include inmemorydb plugin installation that the chat example now requires **Impact:** The bugs in adapter.py and character.py are critical and will cause runtime errors. The missing dependencies will prevent users from running the example successfully. ### Confidence Score: 1/5 - This PR contains critical bugs that will cause runtime failures and prevent the chat example from working - Score reflects two critical logic errors (wrong variable reference in adapter.py:329 and inconsistent attribute access in character.py:70-73) plus missing dependencies that will cause import errors. These issues will break the example for users and cause AttributeErrors at runtime. - Pay close attention to plugins/plugin-inmemorydb/python/elizaos_plugin_inmemorydb/adapter.py (line 329 bug), packages/python/elizaos/bootstrap/providers/character.py (lines 70-73 inconsistency), and examples/chat/python/chat.py (missing python-dotenv dependency)

Important Files Changed

File Analysis | Filename | Score | Overview | |----------|-------|----------| | docs/python-quickstart.md | 3/5 | New documentation file added. Missing plugin-inmemorydb installation instruction that the chat example now requires. | | examples/chat/python/chat.py | 2/5 | Added dotenv and inmemorydb support. Missing python-dotenv dependency in requirements, which will cause import errors. | | packages/python/elizaos/bootstrap/providers/character.py | 2/5 | Fixed to use getattr for optional character attributes. Critical bug: return data dict directly accesses attributes without getattr, causing AttributeError. | | plugins/plugin-inmemorydb/python/elizaos_plugin_inmemorydb/adapter.py | 1/5 | Enhanced get_memories(), create_memory(), and update_memory() to handle Pydantic models. Critical bug in update_memory line 329: uses wrong variable name. |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant chat.py participant dotenv participant AgentRuntime participant OpenAIPlugin participant InMemoryDBPlugin participant InMemoryAdapter participant CharacterProvider User->>chat.py: Run python chat.py chat.py->>dotenv: load_dotenv(env_path) dotenv-->>chat.py: Load .env from repo root chat.py->>AgentRuntime: Create with character and plugins AgentRuntime->>OpenAIPlugin: Initialize OpenAI plugin AgentRuntime->>InMemoryDBPlugin: Initialize InMemoryDB plugin InMemoryDBPlugin->>InMemoryAdapter: create_database_adapter(agent_id) InMemoryAdapter-->>InMemoryDBPlugin: Return adapter instance InMemoryDBPlugin->>AgentRuntime: register_database_adapter(adapter) AgentRuntime->>CharacterProvider: get_character_context() CharacterProvider->>CharacterProvider: Use getattr() for optional attributes CharacterProvider-->>AgentRuntime: Return character context AgentRuntime-->>chat.py: Runtime initialized User->>chat.py: Type message chat.py->>AgentRuntime: handle_message(runtime, memory) AgentRuntime->>InMemoryAdapter: get_memories(params) InMemoryAdapter-->>AgentRuntime: Return memories AgentRuntime->>OpenAIPlugin: Generate response OpenAIPlugin-->>AgentRuntime: Return response AgentRuntime->>InMemoryAdapter: create_memory(memory_dict) InMemoryAdapter-->>AgentRuntime: Memory stored AgentRuntime-->>chat.py: Return result chat.py-->>User: Display response ``` ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * In-memory database plugin for agent memory. * Token-by-token streaming for chat responses and streaming endpoints. * Atropos data-generation, trajectory tooling, and TextWorld agent integrations. * New Tic‚ÄëTac‚ÄëToe AI/player options and interactive configuration. * **Documentation** * Expanded developer setup, examples, runnable chat walkthroughs, and new Atropos CLI flags. * **Other** * Updated Python packaging/requirements and repository-root .env loading for examples. ‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

topPRs.title: fix: plugin-bootstrap (+ sql minor) actions/providers for serverId => messageServerId change
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
# Risks Low # Background ## What does this PR do? ## What kind of change is this? Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) ## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work? User reports of 1.7.0 not working with plugin-discord 1.3.3 # Documentation changes needed? My changes do not require a change to the project documentation. --- > [!NOTE] > **Adds onboarding and role management, refactors providers, and updates schema** > > - New `UPDATE_SETTINGS` action: extracts multiple settings, persists to `world.metadata.settings` with salting/unsalting, generates success/failure/error responses, and completes onboarding when required settings are done > - New/updated `SETTINGS` provider: reads/decrypts settings from world metadata, supports onboarding (DM) vs regular contexts, and outputs concise status with guidance > - New/updated `WORLD` provider: surfaces world/room/channel/participant summaries and structured channel categorization for prompts > - New `UPDATE_ROLE` action: parses XML for role assignments, enforces permission rules, updates `world.metadata.roles`, and persists via `updateWorld` > - Tests: comprehensive event lifecycle and reaction handling, entity join/leave, and platform-agnostic `shouldRespond` mention/reply logic > - SQL: `packages/plugin-sql/src/schema/room.ts` now defines `messageServerId` as `uuid('message_server_id')` (doc/comment cleanup) > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 25d98528e8c98217fbaa63a5e430202a575800e6. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).

Greptile Summary

Completes the migration from deprecated `serverId` to `messageServerId` across plugin-bootstrap actions/providers and plugin-sql schema. **Key Changes:** - Updated `packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/actions/roles.ts` validate function to check `room.messageServerId` instead of accessing `message.content.serverId` - Updated logger metadata keys from `serverId` to `messageServerId` in actions/settings.ts, providers/settings.ts, and action return data in roles.ts - Updated provider output in providers/world.ts to use `messageServerId` field name - Updated JSDoc comment in plugin-sql schema to reflect the correct column name - Updated test mocks and fixtures to use `messageServerId` This PR addresses user-reported compatibility issues between eliza v1.7.0 and plugin-discord v1.3.3 by ensuring consistent use of the new `messageServerId` field name throughout the codebase. The deprecated `serverId` field still exists in the core types for backward compatibility but is no longer referenced in plugin-bootstrap or plugin-sql.

Confidence Score: 5/5

- This PR is safe to merge with minimal risk - The changes are straightforward field name updates that align with an existing migration (commit 6d1b928c). All changes are consistent, the deprecated field remains in core types for backward compatibility, and the PR only updates references in plugin-bootstrap and plugin-sql to use the new field name. The changes fix reported compatibility issues without introducing breaking changes. - No files require special attention

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/plugin-sql/src/schema/room.ts | Updated JSDoc comment from `serverId` to `messageServerId` to match the column definition | | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/actions/settings.ts | Updated logger metadata keys from `serverId` to `messageServerId` for consistency | | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/settings.ts | Updated logger metadata key from `serverId` to `messageServerId` for consistency | | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/world.ts | Updated provider output to use `messageServerId` instead of deprecated `serverId` field | | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/actions/roles.ts | Refactored validation to check room.messageServerId and updated logger/return data to use `messageServerId` |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant Action as Action/Provider participant Runtime participant Database Note over User,Database: serverId ‚Üí messageServerId Migration Flow User->>Action: Trigger action (e.g., UPDATE_ROLE) Action->>Runtime: getRoom(roomId) Runtime->>Database: Query room table Database-->>Runtime: Return Room with messageServerId Runtime-->>Action: Room object alt Validate messageServerId exists Action->>Action: Check room.messageServerId Action->>Runtime: getWorld(worldId) Runtime->>Database: Query world Database-->>Runtime: Return World with messageServerId Runtime-->>Action: World object end Action->>Action: Process with world.messageServerId Action->>Runtime: updateWorld(world) Runtime->>Database: Update world metadata Database-->>Runtime: Success Action->>Action: Log with messageServerId key Action-->>User: Return result with messageServerId Note over Action,Database: All references to deprecated serverId
updated to messageServerId ``` ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Breaking Changes** * Renamed field `serverId` to `messageServerId` across room and world data structures, affecting API responses and database schema. This impacts any code consuming room or world context data. * **Tests** * Updated test utilities and fixtures to reflect the field name change for consistency with production code. ‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

topPRs.title: V2.0.0: dynamic execution engine (test if context is going to blown)
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
Redo #6113 for 2.0.0, first pass --- > [!NOTE] > Introduces a validation-aware, schema-driven prompt execution path and applies it across runtimes and message flows. > > - Adds `dynamic_prompt_exec_from_state`/`dynamicPromptExecFromState` (TS/Python/Rust) with per-field/checkpoint UUID validation codes, required-field checks, and retry with backoff; supports XML/JSON > - Refactors message handling (should-respond, single-shot, multi-step decision, final summary) to use structured schemas instead of ad-hoc parsing > - Implements streaming support in TS with `ValidationStreamExtractor`, `MarkableExtractor`, and streaming context helpers; emits rich `StreamEvent`s > - Introduces shared types: `SchemaRow`, `RetryBackoffConfig`, `StreamEvent(Type)` in Python/Rust/TS type modules > - Adds XML parsing utilities (nested-safe) and normalizes structured responses; basic templating in Rust, Handlebars in TS > - Exposes validation level configuration (0‚Äì3) and model selection; defaults to large text models > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 1e447bbc005cbad715eb819aba27eb35b54aa5b8. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot). ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Added dynamic prompt execution with state injection and schema-driven validation. * Enabled validation-aware streaming with configurable validation levels (0-3). * Introduced built-in retry logic with exponential backoff for improved resilience. * Support for structured output validation across JSON and XML formats. * Per-field and checkpoint-level validation for enhanced data integrity. ‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

Greptile Summary

Introduces `dynamicPromptExecFromState()` across Python, Rust, and TypeScript runtimes to provide schema-driven prompt execution with context validation via UUID codes. The implementation detects when LLMs truncate output due to limited context windows by injecting validation codes at strategic positions (start/middle/end or per-field). Supports four validation levels (0=trusted to 3=full), exponential backoff retries, and optional validation-aware streaming via `ValidationStreamExtractor`. **Key changes:** - Cross-language API consistency for dynamic prompt execution with state injection - Validation code system to detect context overflow (4 levels: trusted, progressive, checkpoint, full) - Streaming integration with progressive validation and retry support - Schema-based structured output parsing (XML/JSON) with required field validation - Performance metrics tracking per model+schema combination (TypeScript only) - Comprehensive type definitions (`SchemaRow`, `RetryBackoffConfig`, `StreamEvent`) **Critical issues in Python implementation:** - Callable prompt invocation wraps state incorrectly (`{"state": state}` vs direct state access) - Template substitution assumes `state.values` has dynamic attributes accessible via `dir()`, incompatible with protobuf State - XML parsing regex `\w+` won't match validation field names with underscores like `code_text_start` **Minor issues:** - Rust template rendering uses basic string replacement instead of full Handlebars compiler - TypeScript `_smartRetryContext` deletion during retry loop prevents reuse on subsequent attempts - ValidationStreamExtractor abort handling may leave inconsistent state

Confidence Score: 3/5

- Python implementation has runtime errors that will break production usage; TypeScript and Rust implementations are safer but need testing - Score reflects critical logical errors in Python (3 bugs that will cause runtime failures), plus architecture differences across languages. TypeScript implementation is most complete with metrics and full Handlebars support. Python bugs must be fixed before merge to avoid breaking callers. - `packages/python/elizaos/runtime.py` requires immediate fixes for callable invocation, state.values access pattern, and XML regex. Test the Python implementation thoroughly before merging.

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/python/elizaos/runtime.py | Adds `dynamic_prompt_exec_from_state` with validation codes and retry logic; has critical bugs in callable invocation, state.values access, and XML parsing regex | | packages/rust/src/runtime.rs | Implements `dynamic_prompt_exec_from_state` with validation and retry; template rendering is basic string replacement vs full Handlebars | | packages/typescript/src/runtime.ts | Implements `dynamicPromptExecFromState` with metrics, streaming, and validation; minor issue with `_smartRetryContext` deletion timing | | packages/typescript/src/utils/streaming.ts | Implements validation-aware streaming with multiple extractor types; minor state inconsistency on abort signal |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Client participant Runtime participant ValidationExtractor participant LLM participant Parser Client->>Runtime: dynamicPromptExecFromState(state, schema, options) Note over Runtime: Generate validation codes
(UUID snippets) Runtime->>Runtime: Build extended schema
with validation fields Runtime->>Runtime: Inject codes into prompt
(initial, middle, end) Runtime->>Runtime: Compile template with
Handlebars/state values alt Streaming enabled Runtime->>ValidationExtractor: Create extractor
(level, schema, codes) end loop Retry attempts (0 to maxRetries) Runtime->>LLM: Generate text with prompt alt Streaming loop Stream chunks LLM-->>ValidationExtractor: chunk ValidationExtractor->>ValidationExtractor: Extract field content ValidationExtractor->>ValidationExtractor: Check per-field codes
(level 0-1) ValidationExtractor-->>Client: Stream validated content end else Non-streaming LLM-->>Runtime: Complete response end Runtime->>Runtime: Clean response
(remove tags) Runtime->>Parser: Parse XML/JSON response Parser-->>Runtime: Parsed fields object Runtime->>Runtime: Normalize structured response alt Validation level 0-1 loop For each field with code Runtime->>Runtime: Check start/end codes match end else Validation level 2-3 Runtime->>Runtime: Check checkpoint codes
(one_initial, one_middle, etc) end Runtime->>Runtime: Validate required fields
are present and non-empty alt All validations pass alt Streaming (level 2-3) Runtime->>ValidationExtractor: flush() ValidationExtractor-->>Client: Buffered content end Runtime->>Runtime: Remove validation code fields Runtime->>Runtime: Update success metrics Runtime-->>Client: Return parsed response else Validation fails alt Has retries remaining Runtime->>Runtime: Calculate backoff delay Runtime->>Runtime: Wait for backoff Note over Runtime: Loop continues with retry else No retries left Runtime->>Runtime: Update failure metrics Runtime-->>Client: Return null end end end ```

topPRs.title: feature/docker starter
topPRs.author: bealers
topPRs.body:
# Docker Infrastructure for elizaOS - foundation stage

Adds Docker support with CLI integration and organized target structure for both starter projects and monorepo development.

## New Commands

```bash
# Development with hot reload
elizaos dev --docker

# Production deployment  
elizaos start --docker
```

## How It Works

### Starter Project Context
When using `elizaos create my-project`, the generated project includes Docker configs:

```bash
elizaos create my-project
cd my-project
elizaos dev --docker    # Starts containerized dev environment
elizaos start --docker  # Starts production-ready container
```

**Benefits:**
- **Consistent environments** across team members
- **No local dependency conflicts** (Node versions, system packages)
- **One-command setup** for new developers
- **Production-like testing** locally

### Monorepo Context
For ElizaOS core development, use organized Docker targets:

```bash
# Development
cd docker/targets/dev && docker-compose up

# Production
cd docker/targets/prod && docker-compose up

# Documentation
cd docker/targets/docs && docker-compose up
```
## Structure

```
docker/targets/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ dev/     # Development: hot reload, debug ports, volume mounting
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ prod/    # Production: optimized builds, health checks, PostgreSQL
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ docs/    # Documentation: fast nginx serving
```

## Testing

```bash
cd docker/tests && bun test

# Test CLI integration
elizaos create test-project
cd test-project
elizaos dev --docker
```

## Compatibility

- No breaking changes
- TEE functionality preserved (`tee-docker-compose.yaml`)
- Project starter templates include Docker configs 

## Next

- reduce prod image size futher, use `docker-slim`
- take prod image and apply to docker registry
- build out `elizaos deploy`, or similar
- document popular providers, Railway, Digital Ocean, Hetzner

completedItems.title: fix(plugin-sql): use sql.raw() for SET LOCAL to avoid parameterizatio‚Ä¶
completedItems.body:
PostgreSQL SET commands do not support parameterized queries. The previous
implementation used Drizzle's sql tagged template which auto-parameterizes
values, causing "syntax error at or near $1" when ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true.

- Chang

completedItems.body:
## Summary

- Use `withEntityContext()` in RLS tests instead of raw `pg.Client`
- Add `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true` to CI
- Remove redundant `withEntityContext.test.ts`

Ensures CI catches the `$1` parameterization bug if it regresses.

completedItems.title: fix(plugin-sql): add pool config, error handler, and fix PGLite shutdown
completedItems.body:
## Summary

Fixes critical issues in plugin-sql that could cause runtime crashes and connection problems.

### Changes

1. **Fix `null as T` return** (`pglite/adapter.ts`)
   - Throw error instead of returning null cast as generic type T

topContributors.summary: standujar: Focused on strengthening the database infrastructure and security within the elizaos/eliza repository, most notably by implementing Neon serverless support and enhancing Row Level Security (RLS) schemas in PR #6343. They demonstrated a significant commitment to system reliability by contributing over 7,700 lines of test code to isolate RLS contexts (PR #6330) and addressing compatibility issues for PGLite (PR #6339). Beyond these merged improvements, they worked on optimizing runtime initialization through parallelization and provided technical feedback via 11 total reviews and comments. Their primary focus this month was on bug fixes and extensive test coverage, particularly within the SQL plugin architecture.

Their work involved extensive modifications across 378 files, demonstrating a significant commitment to bug fixes and testing infrastructure. Overall, their primary focus this month was on stabilizing and optimizing core database plugins and backend configurations.

This substantial contribution involved over 2,800 lines of code and established a foundation for complex features like class evolution and visual identity systems, which they further detailed through 11 new feature requests and bug reports. Beyond these gamification enhancements, they improved site accessibility by adding an XSL stylesheet for browser-rendered RSS feeds in #188 and identified critical performance bottlenecks regarding memory consumption in the build process. Their work this month primarily centered on feature development and configuration, significantly advancing the project's interactive and data-driven capabilities.

greptile-apps: Focused exclusively on providing feedback and guidance through 14 code reviews and 4 pull request comments this month.
